newsitem.title: USA: Phamis sees lower-than-forecast Q4 net.
newsitem.headline: Phamis sees lower-than-forecast Q4 net.

text.p: Phamis Inc on Friday said it expected to report fourth-quarter earnings of about $0.10 per share, lower than analysts' estimates and the company's own forecasts.
Analysts on average had estimated Phamis' fourth-quarter earnings at $0.14 per share, according to a First Call survey. Last year, the company earned $0.15 per share in its fourth quarter.

Phamis' estimate for the 1996 fourth quarter does not include a previously announced special charge of $500,000 related to the signing of a development contract with London-based Chelsea & Westminster Healthcare NHS Trust.

Phamis, which provides healthcare information systems to large and mid-sized providers, said its earnings were hurt by a major hardware sale being postponed to 1997. It also said severe weather conditions hampered operations in November and December.
The company said its outlook for 1997 was bullish. It expects to exceed analysts' earnings estimate of $0.70 per share for 1997.
It also expects to report a revenue backlog of more than $85 million as of December 31.
